info.name: KNAPP Smoke Test
info.description:
This collection is created for easy pre-set up for a smoke test during the **KNAPP PRODUCTION DEPLOY**.

Production Testing

To run on Prod make sure:
1. You have an admin user for Prod environment you're testing 2. Your credentials are filled in **FIREBASE_LOGIN** and **FIREBASE_PASSWORD** environment variables 3. **RUN_IN_PROD** variable in Globals is set to true

Sequence of actions:

1. Find products for order

**Dependency**: NO
**Request**: Get Ambient and Chilled Items

2. Create an Order.

**Dependency**: YES. Dependent on previously found items (**#1**).
**Request**: CreateOrder

3. Split order.

**Dependency**: YES. Order is created
**Request**: orderSplit

4. Get Inventory of items.

**Dependency**: YES. Dependent on previously found items (**#1**).
**Request**: Get Number of items from the Inv Snapshot

5. Decanting Results

**Dependency**: NO.
**Request**: Get most recent products adjustments

6. Specific Items Decanting Results

**Dependency**: NO.
**Request**: Check specific item adjustments in last N minutes

7. Cancel order

**Dependency**: YES. Order is created
**Request**: Cancel order

exec: //number of chilled products to be found (change the number if you need more)
//number of ambient products to be found (change the number if you need more)
var osrProducts = []; //all products from the selves-snapshot that match "address=01K"
var products = []; //result array to store all found products
console.log("====================== Pulling Chilled and Ambient Products for " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ======================");
//find ambient and chilled items and save to array

request.description:
Response return the items stored on OSR (01K) shelves. The script in the **Tests** will then call the getFulfillmentArticle request to find the specified number of ambient and chilled items. </br>
To change the number of chilled and/or ambient items, go to the **Tests** tab and change the var:

    var c = 2; //number of chilled items
    var a = 2; //number of ambient products

The resulted json array will be written in collection variable **productsJson**, to be later retrieved. </br>

**Found Ambient and Chilled products are printed in console**
____________________________________________

item.name: Get Ambient, Chilled, and Frozen Items

exec: throw Error("Running in prod is prohibited!");
//set fulfillment date-time and stage-by-date-time for Order
//service-window-start for retailers on Service Contracts, fulfillment-datetime on MFC Cutoff
//generate order line items, using found chilled and ambient products
console.info("Creating Order# " + orderId + " on " + pm.environment.get('ENV') + " " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE"));
//use spoke Id for Winter in body
console.log("!!! ERROR in Order creation!!! Response code: " + pm.response.code + ", " + JSON.stringify(jsondata));
console.log ("Check MFC CUTOFF/Service Contract time in Environment Variables ORDER_TIME");
console.log("===================== Order " + pm.collectionVariables.get("orderId") + " created successfully on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " =======================");

request.description:
Creates an order, using OMS endpoint.</br>

The orderId is built in **Pre-req** in the format and saved into collection variable **orderId**:

    var orderId = "SQ_" + date + "_1";

An example: **SQ_210309_1**</br>

The products retrived from the **productJson** collection variable, that are founf in "Get Ambient and Chilled Items" request

exec: console.info("!!! ERROR in Order split!!! Response code: " + pm.response.code + ", " + JSON.stringify(jsondata));
console.log("================ Split process has started for order " + pm.collectionVariables.get("orderId") + " on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ================");

item.name: Get number of items from the order from Inv Snapshot

exec: console.log("========================= Calculating Products Quantity on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ==========================");

request.description: The script in the **Tests** tab will print the quantity of the products from **productsJson** collection variable (Products that were found beforehand in the **Get Ambient and Chilled Products** request)

exec: var n = 1; //specify number of minutes (look up data for last N minutes)
//get Inventory snapshot and collect qty on shelf after adjustment
//get Fulfillment articles and save product temperature
console.log("=================== All items adjusted  during last " + pm.collectionVariables.get("n") + " minutes on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ====================");

item.name: Check specific item adjustments in last N minutes

exec: var n = 9; //specify number of minutes (look up data for last N minutes)
var products = pm.collectionVariables.get("products"); // products to look for adjustments
products.forEach(prod => productsMap.set(prod, {"message":"Adjustments are not found for current product"}));
//get Inventory snapshot and collect qty on shelf after adjustment
//get Fulfillment articles and save product temperature
console.log("================= Specific items adjusted  during last " + pm.collectionVariables.get("n") + " minutes on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ==================");
console.log("===================== Order " + pm.collectionVariables.get("orderId") + " on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " has been cancelled =======================");

request.description: Request cancels the order, created in CreateOrder Request.

**Found Ambient and Chilled products are printed in console**

exec: throw Error("Running in prod is prohibited!");
//set tomorrow's date for Order (date now + hr*min*s*ms)
//service-window-start for retailers on Service Contracts, fulfillment-datetime on MFC Cutoff
//generate order line items, using found chilled and ambient products
console.info("Creating Order# " + orderId + " on " + pm.environment.get('ENV') + " " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE"));
console.log("!!! ERROR in Order creation!!! Response code: " + pm.response.code + ", " + JSON.stringify(jsondata));
console.log ("Check MFC CUTOFF/Service Contract time in Environment Variables ORDER_TIME");
console.log("===================== Order " + pm.collectionVariables.get("orderId") + " created successfully on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " =======================");

request.description:
Creates an order, using OMS endpoint.</br>

The orderId is built in **Pre-req** in the format and saved into collection variable **orderId**:

    var orderId = "SQ_" + date + "_1";

An example: **SQ_210309_1**</br>

The products retrived from the **productJson** collection variable, that are founf in "Get Ambient and Chilled Items" request

exec: console.info("!!! ERROR in Order split!!! Response code: " + pm.response.code + ", " + JSON.stringify(jsondata));
console.log("================ Split process has started for order " + pm.collectionVariables.get("orderId") + " on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ================");

item.name: Get number of items from the order from Inv Snapshot

exec: console.log("========================= Calculating Products Quantity on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ==========================");

request.description: The script in the **Tests** tab will print the quantity of the products from **productsJson** collection variable (Products that were found beforehand in the Get Ambient and Chilled Products request)

exec: //get Inventory snapshot and collect qty on shelf after adjustment
//get Fulfillment articles and save product temperature
console.log("=================== All items adjusted  during last " + pm.collectionVariables.get("n") + " minutes on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ====================");
var n = 240; //specify number of minutes (look up data for last N minutes)
console.log("===================== Order " + pm.collectionVariables.get("orderId") + " on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " has been cancelled =======================");

request.description: Request cancels the order, created in CreateOrder Request.

item.name: Check specific item adjustments in last N minutes

exec: var n = 240; //specify number of minutes (look up data for last N minutes)
var products = pm.collectionVariables.get("products"); // products to look for adjustments
products.forEach(prod => productsMap.set(prod, {"message":"Adjustments are not found for current product"}));
//get Inventory snapshot and collect qty on shelf after adjustment
//get Fulfillment articles and save product temperature
console.log("=================== All items adjusted  during last " + pm.collectionVariables.get("n") + " minutes on " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE3") + " ====================");
//number of chilled products to be found (change the number if you need more)
//number of ambient products to be found (change the number if you need more)
var osrProducts = []; //all products from the selves-snapshot that match "address=01K"
var products = []; //result array to store all found products
console.log("====================== Pulling Chilled and Ambient Products for " + pm.environment.get("MFC_TOM_CODE") + " ======================");
//find ambient and chilled items and save to array

request.description:
Response return the items stored on OSR (01K) shelves. The script in the **Tests** will then call the getFulfillmentArticle request to find the specified number of ambient and chilled items. </br>
To change the number of chilled and/or ambient items, go to Tests tab and change the var:

    var c = 2; //number of chilled items
    var a = 2; //number of ambient products

The resulted json array will be written in collection variable **productsJson**, to be later retrieved. </br>

**Found Ambient and Chilled products are printed in console**
